level.text: 1799.1 When used in this chapter, the following terms have the meaningsscribed:
Director – the agency head of the Office of Contracting and ProcurementOCP) or the Chief Procurement Officer (CPO).

Emergency Condition – A situation which creates a threat to public health,elfare, or safety such as may arise by reason of floods, epidemics, riots, orquipment failures. The existence of such condition creates an immediate anderious need for goods or services that cannot be met through normal procurementethods and the lack of which would seriously threaten: (a) the function ofistrict government; (b) the preservation or protection of property; or (c) theealth or safety of any person.
